condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Reducing Social Inequities: By end-2020, the social protection system is ready to provide inclusive quality community-based support services.

description.narrative: To accelerate reforms in the system of social service delivery in Turkmenistan, the UNICEF's ten-year Introduction of Social Services Roadmap and Action Plan with Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Turkmenistan constituted the base of the two-year Joint Programme on community-based social services, receiving full support from the Government of Turkmenistan and funding from the Joint SDG Fund. The joint programme will be implemented by UNRC, UNICEF, UNDP, UNFPA, UNODC with UNICEF and the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection of Turkmenistan in lead. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:22/01/2020

title.narrative: Degree of Development of the Quality Assurance System for Social Work

baseline.value: Criteria (Criteria (i) Normative frameworks Score 1: There is no normative framework Criteria (ii) System of supervision and support Score 1: There is no system Criteria (iii) System for licensing/accreditation of social work Score 1: Work has not started to define the system Criteria (iv) Data collection systems Score 1: There is no system Final assessment: Score of 4: No development i) Normative frameworks Score 1: There is no normative framework

target.value: 2020:Criteria (i) Normative frameworks Score 1.5: Framework is in the early drafting stages Criteria (ii) System of supervision and support Score 1.5: System is in early development stages including piloting Criteria (iii) System for licensing/ accreditation of social work Score 1: Work is starting to define the system Criteria (iv) Data collection systems Score 1.5: System is in early development stage or early roll-out Final assessment: Score of 5-8: Early develop

title.narrative: Piloting of provision of additional social support services is started in 2 locations

target.value: 2020:Social work practice is initiated in selected etraps of Turkmenistan and initial plan for social services scale up is available

actual.value: 2019:The roadmap of 2018 constituted the basis for development of a Joint Programme on improvement of community-based social services in Turkmenistan. The programme was among the 30 selected globally and was signed by the Government at the end of the year.

title.narrative: Availability of an adopted child rights monitoring framework as part of the (currently) draft National Plan of Action on Child Rights (NPAC) (Yes/No)

baseline.value: Draft framework available as part of the draft NPAC

target.value: 2020:A mid-term assessment of the NPAC is initiated linked to an improved and easy-to-follow indicator framework

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF Turkmenistan supported the Government in consultations on mechanisms of implementation of the National Plan. Some actions were further refined with revisited timelines and clarified accountabilities. However, further refinement of the indicator framework and assessment towards achievement of

title.narrative: The Ombudsman Office establishment and functioning to do quality monitoring on child rights

baseline.value: The office of the Ombudsman is established in 2016 but has no capacity to address child rights issues

target.value: 2020:The Ombudsman Office capacity is strengthened in terms of (1) Access to Justice, (2) monitoring of child care institutions, (3) child rights promotion at the sub-national level and (4) CRC reporting, including alternative reporting.

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF Turkmenistan continued its support to the Ombudsman Office in promotion and monitoring of child rights. Velayat-level workshops on awareness on child rights and Ombudsman's role in general continued. On the other hand, establishment of an advisory body with the participation of young people,
